hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: Said ibn Abi Arubah and Jarir al-Razi narrated from him. Qais ibn Hafs said to me: Mu'tamir narrated to us, he heard Thabit ibn Zaid, from Azhar, from Anisah (or Anis), that Zaid entered upon al-Mukhtar, so he said to him: O Aba Amir.

narrators.name: Qais ibn Hafs
narrators.full_name: Qais ibn Hafs al-Kufi (or Qais ibn Hafs al-A'war)
reliabilityIssues: saduq - acceptable but not highest level

narrators.name: Mu'tamir
narrators.full_name: Mu'tamir ibn Sulayman al-Basri (or Mu'tamir ibn Sulayman)

narrators.name: Thabit ibn Zaid
narrators.full_name: Thabit ibn Zaid ibn Arqum al-Ansari (or possibly Thabit ibn Zaid ibn Thabit)

narrators.name: Azhar
narrators.full_name: Azhar (specific full name identification needed - possibly Azhar ibn Abd Allah or similar)
reliabilityIssues: majhul al-hal - only appears in this chain without corroboration

narrators.name: Anisah
narrators.full_name: Anisah (also possibly spelled Anis, specific full identification needed)
reliabilityIssues: majhul - not identified, unknown reliability status

narrators.name: Zaid
narrators.full_name: Zaid (likely Zaid ibn Arqum, referenced by the name Zaid in the narrative)

chainIssues: Azhar is majhul al-hal (unknown condition) - only appears in this chain without documentation
Anisah is majhul (unidentified) - not documented in reliable sources
Qais ibn Hafs is only saduq, representing the lower end of acceptable narrators
Multiple uses of 'an (عَنْ) create ambiguity in the transmission
This is a mawquf (companion's statement), not a marfu' hadith from the Prophet ﷺ
The entry provides a narrative of an incident (Zaid visiting al-Mukhtar) with greeting formula rather than religious ruling

potential_issues.issue: Two majhul narrators in the middle of the chain
potential_issues.impact: Azhar (majhul al-hal) and Anisah (majhul) are both unknown narrators, creating significant weakness in the chain's reliability.

potential_issues.issue: Qais ibn Hafs is only saduq
potential_issues.impact: The first narrator in the chain has only acceptable reliability status, not the higher level required for strong hadith authentication.

potential_issues.issue: Ambiguous transmission terms
potential_issues.impact: Multiple uses of 'an, especially with unknown narrators (Azhar and Anisah), create potential discontinuity in the chain.

Topics: Incident of Zaid ibn Arqum visiting al-Mukhtar al-Thaqafi

hadiths.english_translation: From Ibn Sireen, from Aisha. (This is a) mursal hadith. Malik ibn Mughol narrated from him.

narrators.alternative_names: Muhammad ibn Sireen al-Basri, Ibn Sireen

narrators.name: Aisha

narrators.alternative_names: Aisha, Mother of the Believers, Al-Siddiqah

chainIssues: This is explicitly marked as MURSAL (مرسل) - the chain is disconnected
While both Ibn Sireen and Aisha are reliable, the mursal classification indicates that Ibn Sireen did not directly hear from Aisha
Muhammad ibn Sireen (d. 110 AH) was born in 33 AH, making him younger than Aisha, but there is doubt about whether he directly heard from her

potential_issues.issue: Hadith is explicitly mursal (disconnected chain)
potential_issues.impact: The source document explicitly identifies this hadith as mursal, meaning the chain is broken between Ibn Sireen and Aisha. Mursal hadith requires additional corroboration to be considered reliable, as there may be an omitted narrator between them.

potential_issues.issue: No actual hadith content provided
potential_issues.impact: The entry only indicates the chain is mursal from Aisha without providing the actual content or meaning of the hadith.

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: From Salim al-Muharibi. Sulayman said to me: from al-Walid ibn Muslim, he heard Thabit, he saw Wathilah and Bilal ibn Abi al-Dardah as governors over it (a place). And Abu Qudamah said: al-Walid narrated to us, from Thabit ibn Sarj Abu Salamah.

reliabilityIssues: saduq yugrib - has strange/uncommon hadiths; requires caution

narrators.full_name: Thabit (likely Thabit ibn Sarj based on the reference in the second version)
reliabilityIssues: majhul al-hal - reliability not documented for this Thabit
